1.7 GHz AMD Athlon II Neo, AMD V105 1.2GHz | display = {{convert|10.1|in|cm|abbr=on}}, {{convert|11.6|in|cm|abbr=on}}, {{convert|8.9|in|cm|abbr=on}} 1024Ã600, 1366Ã768 LCD TFT, HD Glossy LED LCD | dimensions = WÃDÃH {{convert|9.8|in|cm|abbr=on}} Ã {{convert|6.7|in|cm|abbr=on}} Ã {{convert|1|in|cm|abbr=on}} | weight = {{convert|2.19|lb|kg|abbr=on}} for SSD, 3 cell battery unit
{{convert|2.78|lb|kg|abbr=on}} for HDD, 6 cell battery unit }} [[File:Acer Aspire One D250.jpg|thumb|The Ultra-Thin Acer Aspire One D250]] [[File:Acer D255E Bestbuy jeh.jpg|thumb|D255E]] '''Acer Aspire One''' is a line of subcompact notebook computers, or [[netbook]]s, released in July 2008 by [[Acer Inc.]]{{cite web | url = http://us.acer.com/public/page92.do?sp=page29&dau42.oid=13762&UserCtxParam=0&GroupCtxParam=0&dctx1=25&CountryISOCtxParam=US&LanguageISOCtxParam=en&ctx3=-1&ctx4=United+States&crc=3201121738 | title = Acer US press release}} {{Dead link|date=May 2009}} It is based on the Intel Atom platform, which consists of the [[Intel Atom]] processor, Intel 945GSE Express chipset and Intel 82801GBM (ICH7M) I/O controller,[http://www.acer.com/aspireone/ About â Platform] and is available in several shell colors: seashell white, sapphire blue, golden brown, onyx black, and coral pink. Higher end models were released in June 2010 consisting of the AMD [[Athlon II]] Neo processor and ATI Radeon HD 4225 graphics controller. These are available in onyx black, antique brass, or mesh black shells depending on model.http://www.eweek.com/c/a/Desktops-and-Notebooks/Acer-Puts-AMD-Chips-into-Aspire-One-Netbooks-258635/ Also released was a version of the Aspire One 521 with an [[AMD-V]]105 processor running at 1.2GHz, an ATI Radeon 4225 graphics controller, and equipped with a [[HDMI]] port. http://macles.blogspot.com/2010/04/acer-aspire-one-521.html Its main competitors in the low-cost netbook market are the [[Asus Eee PC]] line and the [[Dell Inspiron Mini 9]]. ==History== The line is manufactured for Acer Inc. by [[Quanta Computer]].{{cite web|author=Yen Ting Chen |coauthors=Joseph Tsai |url=http://www.digitimes.com/systems/a20080710PD222.html |title=Wistron to start manufacturing netbooks |publisher=DigiTimes |date=2008-07-11 |accessdate=2009-05-06}} Quanta will be phased out as a supplier to Acer; production of the Acer Aspire One line will be shifting to other manufacturers in 2009.{{cite web | author = Yen Ting Chen | coauthors = Joseph Tsai | url = http://www.digitimes.com/news/a20081015PD214.html | title = Acer to transfer netbook orders to Compal and Wistron next year, Quanta left out | publisher = DigiTimes | date = 2008-10-16 | accessdate = 2009-05-06 }} {{Subscription}} ==Operating systems== ===Windows=== Windows XP Home Edition SP3 is installed on the models with a name ending in ''X'', or ending in ''B'' followed by another letter denoting color. It is also possible to install and run [[Windows Vista]] or [[Windows 7]] on the earlier model laptop. In high-end versions appearing during 2009, Windows Vista is pre-installed. The lack of a [[DVD-ROM]] drive requires creating a [[bootable USB flash drive]], using a USB external DVD drive or [[Preboot Execution Environment|PXE]] boot network install. ===Linux=== Models with names starting in ''L'', or ending in ''A'' followed by a letter for color, are shipped with [[Linpus Linux]] Lite, which is based on [[Fedora (operating system)|Fedora]] 8.{{cite web|url=http://www.linuxhaxor.net/2008/09/15/linpus-linux-lite-review/|title=review of Linpus Linux Lite.}}{{cite web|url=http://macles.blogspot.com/2008/12/acer-aspire-one-recovery-dvd.html |title=Acer Aspire One Linpus Linux Lite recovery DVD online |publisher=Macles Blog |date=2008-12-27 |accessdate=2009-05-06}} This offers a simplified user interface, with default applications like the [[Firefox]] 2 browser, [[OpenOffice.org]] 2.3, ''Acer One Mail'' and ''Acer One Messenger'' available directly on the main screen. The default desktop environment has been designed to hide advanced features from the user and to prevent modification. It is possible to modify the system to present a more traditional [[Xfce]] 4 desktop, enable more advanced features such as [[context menu]]s, or install additional software.{{cite web | url = http://www.laptopmag.com/advice/how-to/aspire-one-apps.aspx | title = Add Apps to the Acer Aspire one | work = LaptopMag.com | publisher = Bedford Communications, Inc. | date = 2009-03-15 | accessdate = 2009-05-06 }} It is possible to install and run other [[Linux distribution]]s on the Acer Aspire One, and some specially customised Linux distributions have been designed to offer [[out of the box]] functionality. These include: *[[Joli OS]]{{cite web | url= http://www.jolicloud.com/product/compatibility | title=Jolicloud Compatible Devices}} *[[Ubuntu Netbook Edition]] (UNE) *[[Linux4One]]{{cite web |url= eeepc.itrunsonlinux.com/the-news/1-latest-news/242-linux4one-ubuntu-for-the-acer-aspire-one- |title=Linux4one Ubuntu for the Acer Aspire One |publisher=ItrunsonLinux.com |date=2008-12-27 |accessdate=2009-05-06}} *[[Kuki Linux]]{{cite web|url= eeepc.itrunsonlinux.com/the-news/1-latest-news/266-kuki-linux-20-for-the-acer-aspire-one|title=Kuki Linux 2.0 for the Acer Aspire One}} *[[ArchOne]]{{cite web | url= http://archone.sourceforge.net | title=ArchOne}} *[[Moblin]]{{cite web | url= http://moblin.org | title=Moblin Tested Netbooks}} *[[Slitaz]] Other distributions of the Linux operating system will also run, such as: *[[Arch Linux]]{{cite web|url=http://wiki.archlinux.org/index.php/Acer_Aspire_One |title=Acer Aspire One â ArchWiki |date=2010-01-12 |accessdate=2010-02-14}} *[[Fedora (GNU/Linux distribution)|Fedora]]{{cite web|author=Jorge |url=http://jorge.fbarr.net/2008/11/10/fedora-10-on-the-acer-aspire-one/ |title=The road to Elysium / Fedora 10 on the Acer Aspire One |date=2008-11-10 |accessdate=2009-05-06}} *[[Debian]] *[[Mandriva|Mandriva Linux]]{{cite press release|url=http://www.mandriva.com/enterprise/en/company/press/mandriva-announces-a-new-solution-for-netbooks-mandriva-mini |title=Mandriva announces a new solution for netbooks: Mandriva Mini |publisher=Mandriva linux |accessdate=2009-05-06}} *[[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]], [[Ubuntu Studio]]{{cite web | url = https://help.ubuntu.com/community/AspireOne110L |title=AspireOne110L |publisher=Community Ubuntu Documentation |accessdate=2009-05-06}}{{cite web | url = https://help.ubuntu.com/community/AspireOne | title = AspireOne | publisher = Community Ubuntu Documentation | accessdate = 2009-05-15 }}[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/AA1 Aspire One reorganized page] *[[Eeebuntu]]{{cite web | url = http://www.liliputing.com/2009/01/eeebuntu-20-ubuntu-made-for-eee-pcs-runs-on-acer-aspire-one.html | title = Eeebuntu 2.0: Made for Eee PC, runs on Acer Aspire One |publisher=Liliputing |date=2009-01-15 |accessdate=2009-11-26 }} *[[openSUSE]][http://en.opensuse.org/Acer_Aspire_One Acer Aspire One â openSUSE] *[[Slackware]] *[[Linux Mint]] *[[PCLinuxOS]]{{cite web | url = http://pclosmag.com/html/Issues/200909/page08.html | title=Experience with the Acer Aspire One and PCLinuxOS 2009.2 | publisher=PCLinuxOS Magazine |accessdate=2010-03-09}} * [[MeeGo]] * [[Puppy Linux]] ===Mac OS X=== Through the [[OSx86]] project, an Aspire One can boot and run a modified version of [[Mac OS X]], including ''iAtkos'', ''iDeneb'', "XxX" and ''Kalyway'' distributions. This procedure is not supported by Apple or Acer.[http://nazimjamil.com/?r=Installing_OS_X_onto_your_Acer_Aspire_1 Installing OS X onto your Acer Aspire 1] ===Others=== In December 2009, Acer stated they will be the first to ship with [[Google Chrome OS|Google Chrome operating system]].http://www.pcworld.com/article/183513/acer_well_be_first_to_launch_a_chrome_os_netbook.html ==Storage== === Solid state drives === {{Anchor|SSD|SSD drives}} The A110 model ships with an 8 GB or 16 GB [[solid-state drive]] (SSD), although some models do not come with one. Early 8 GB models come with the Intel Z-P230, model SSDPAMM0008G1. This SSD has been criticized for its slow read and write speed. Intel lists the drive's maximum speeds as 38 MB/s read and 10 MB/s write.[http://download.intel.com/design/flash/nand/z-p230/319955.pdf ]{{Dead link|date=May 2009}} Later models come with the slightly faster Samsung P-SSD 1800. ===Hard disks=== The HDD is a regular 2.5-in 5400 rpm SATA drive with 80, 120, 160, 250, 500 or 750 GB. A number of different drives have been reported so far: Seagate ST980811AS and ST9120817AS,http://www.seagate.com/staticfiles/support/disc/manuals/notebook/momentus/5400.4/SATA/100468842a.pdf Western Digital WD1200BEVS,[http://www.wdc.com/de/products/products.asp?driveid=200 WD Scorpio Blue-SATA-Festplattenlaufwerke mit 120 GB (WD1200BEVS)] WD1600BEVT, WD7500KPVT, Hitachi HTS543212L9A300,http://www.hitachigst.com/tech/techlib.nsf/techdocs/C51A283F52498251862573FA005A3C98/$file/Travelstar_5K320_DS.pdf Hitachi HTS543216L9A300, Hitachi HTS543216L9SA00, Toshiba MK1655GSX and Toshiba MK1652GSX. ===Expansion slot=== There is also an SD/[[Secure Digital HC|SDHC]] storage expansion slot on all models for additional storage (the 533 model does not support SDHC as verified by Acer support UK). On Linux versions this automatically expands the space of the SSD or HDD using [[aufs]]. Windows XP models treat it as a normal removable drive. Some models have a second slot that functions as a standard multi-in-1 flash memory card reader.{{Citation needed|date=May 2009}} The 110 BIOS does not allow one to boot an operating system from this slot, but the 150 BIOS is capable of booting from an SDHC card in the slot. {{Citation needed|date=July 2009}} (Note: with Linux, it is possible essentially to boot from HD or USB by using a /boot partition on the regular boot device and an initrd that loads the real OS from the slot). Using a non-[[journaling file system]] such as [[ext2]] on Linux prolongs the life of a solid state drive (SSD).https://help.ubuntu.com/community/AA1/Installation ==Power management== The [[Intel Atom]] platform has a specified maximum [[thermal design power|TDP]] of 11.8 W. Individual figures are 2.5 W for the N270 processor, 6 W for the 945GSE chipset and 3.3 W for the 82801GBM I/O controller.{{cite web|url=http://ark.intel.com/system.aspx?groupID=36331&configID=27616&chipsetID=36550 |title=Intel Atom Processor with Mobile Intel 945GSE Express Chipset |publisher=Intel |accessdate=2009-05-06}}{{cite web|url=http://ark.intel.com/cpu.aspx?groupId=36331 |title=Intel Atom Processor N270 (512 K Cache, 1.60 GHz, 533 MHz FSB) |publisher=Intel |accessdate=2009-05-06}}{{cite web|url=http://ark.intel.com/chipset.aspx?familyID=35553 |title=Mobile Intel 945GSE Express Chipset |publisher=Intel |accessdate=2009-05-06}}{{cite web|url=http://ark.intel.com/product.aspx?id=27680 |title=Intel 82801GBM I/O Controller |publisher=Intel |accessdate=2009-05-06}} The AUO B089AW01 LCD panel is rated at a maximum power consumption of 3 W.http://www.gblcd.com/datacenter/au/B089AW01_V0.pdf Typical readâwrite power consumption for the SSD is around 0.3 W, and 0.01 W when idle. The different HDDs are rated at about 1.5â2.5 W for readâwrite operations and around 0.7 W when idle. The official ratings for the battery are up to 3 hours for the three cell, and up to 7 hours for the six cell.{{Citation needed|date=May 2009}} [[Linpus Linux]] Lite has been optimized by Acer for lower power consumption. Battery life is shorter on HDD configurations with Windows XP, at approximately 2.5 hours for the three cell.{{Citation needed|date=October 2008}} Although the standard three cell battery is 2.2 Ah, some users have reported 2.4 Ah and 2.9 Ah batteries from the factory. Various suppliers online now carry aftermarket batteries, including the six cell. Aftermarket nine cell batteries are available though they are quite heavy, and also protrude out of the back, reducing the aesthetics but improving airflow. ==Specifications== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; width:auto;" |- ! rowspan=2 | Model ! rowspan=2 | [[operating system|OS]] ! rowspan=2 | [[display device|Display]] ! colspan=2 | [[data storage device|Storage]] ! rowspan=2 | [[random access memory|RAM]] ! rowspan=2 | [[battery (electricity)|Battery]] ! rowspan=2 | [[webcam]] ! rowspan=2 | [[Bluetooth]] limited availability ! rowspan=2 | Availability |- ! architecture Celeron U3400.http://www.aspireoneuser.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=87&t=21270#p129493 ||6 cell (4.4Ah) || 1.3 megapixel | rowspan=1 {{Yes}} ||[[Denmark|DA]], possibly [[Europe|EU]] |} Acer AOD model (10.1" screen) Product Comparison Guide, in the form of a spreadsheet file download, is available from increa.com.http://www.increa.com/computers While the Aspire one 522 is sold with Linpus Linux (in Thailand), it seems imperfectly supported by Linux so far (problems with internal microphone, bluetooth and wired network). ==Additional hardware== Since November 2008 the 3G-enabled model Aspire One A150X-3G is available in Europe,[http://parabook.de/2008/10/20/acer-aspire-one-a150x-3g-kommt/ ] {{Dead link|date=May 2009}} while models with 3G modems will begin shipping in the United Kingdom in December and are denoted by the letter ''G'' in their model number. The first generation Aspire One webcam is an Acer Labs International M5608 camera controller with attached 0.3 MP SuYin or 1.3 MP LiteOn CMOS sensor. Some models of the Aspire One use an Intel 945GSE chipset which only supports 2 GB of RAM. Installing memory modules larger than 2 GB has caused the Aspire to fail the [[power-on self-test]]. Model 522, featuring the [[AMD Fusion]] C-50 chip, has been reported to work with 4 GB installed (although the included Windows 7 Starter edition has an artificially imposed 2 GB limit). ==AO751h (751h)== The AO751h has the larger 11.6" screen with an LED backlit display and a 1366x768 native resolution. It includes a 1GB/667 MHz DDR2 SDRAM memory option (2 GB being the maximum), a 160 GB HDD option, Bluetooth option, Intel northbridge US15W, and an OS option for Windows Vista Home Basic edition or Windows XP Media Center Edition. All AO751h units are powered by an Intel Atom Z520 processor running at 1240 MHz. The US15W system controller incorporates a GMA500 video core. The AO751h has a dual power (AC/DC) option. The six cell battery provides the working time of about 8 hours. Besides the mentioned specifications of the AO751h it supports 10/100 Mbps Ethernet interface, 802.11g Wi-Fi card, standard VGA-out jack, 3 USB 2.0 ports, a Memory Card reader (xD-Picture Card, SD Card), as well as Microphone In jack (1/8" Mini), Headphone Out jack (1/8" Mini). One of the cons is the relatively small TouchPad and mouse buttons. Large and comfortable keyboard is one of the distinguishing features of the device. There have been reports of some AO751h units randomly [[freezing]], which has led to recalls in Denmark.[http://www.aspireoneuser.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=87&t=18421] Although some users have reported that having their motherboards replaced by Acer solved the problem and Acer officially reporting that the fix is to install an updated BIOS,[http://netbooks-us.custhelp.com/app/answers/detail/a_id/278/kw/freeze/r_id/166 Acer Fix Published: "Aspire One AO751h shuts down or freezes unexpectedly"] there is a growing number of reports from users worldwide who continue to encounter the reported random freezes despite their machines having been sent back to Acer for repair (in some cases more than once).[http://www.aspireoneuser.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=87&t=16164] '''AOA150 speaker vibration = and other Misc Issues''' The 8.9" models have an improperly designed speaker location that causes vibration to the internal hard drive, causing it to be problematic. The right speaker is especially prone to this. Audio frequencies around 1 [[kHz]] cause the hard drive to almost stop responding. Full volume MP3/audio playback easily causes these models to run extremely slowly, or crash because of unresponsive disk I/O. This problem also causes bad sectors, crashed hard drives and corrupt Windows partitions in the long term. Even sound from an external speaker with 1 kHz tone test causes this hard drive behaviour. SSD drives do not suffer from this problem. Workarounds identified are: listening to music at a lower volume, using only the left speaker, using a software equalizer to tone down the 1 kHz frequency, replacing the hard drive with an SSD, and trying to install soft sound dampening material around the speakers and the hard drive. '''Other Misc issues - the InsydeH20 BIOS''' On some early AOA150 Linpus Lite 120GB hard drive models the InsydeH20 BIOS may not offer an `IDE' mode in the BIOS menu. This can make it difficult/impossible to boot from an external CDROM Drive - e.g., to install Windows XP. At various times in 2010, a check of the automatic updates for the Linpus Lite OS give a `no updates available' response. Several websites provide information about the speaker problem: * [http://www.aspireoneuser.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=24&t=12758 Aspire One User Group] * [http://gadgetmix.com/index/tip-for-acer-aspire-one-89-inch-users-do-not-play-music-through-speakers-at-full-volume/] http://www.engadget.com/2009/03/26/8-9-inch-acer-aspire-one-said-to-have-hard-drive-flaw-distaste/http://www.tomshardware.co.uk/forum/51316-20-acer-aspire-audio-problemshttp://forum.notebookreview.com/showthread.php?t=366487 ==Aspire One Happy== The Acer Aspire One Happy is a 10 inch netbook with different [[Operating system|operating systems:]] ([[Android (operating system)|Android]] 2.1 and [[Windows 7]]). It was launched by [[Acer Inc.]] in November 2010. The computer is nearly identical to the Acer Aspire One D255. The main difference is that the Happy case comes in several different color options.http://crave.cnet.co.uk/laptops/acer-aspire-one-happy-lappy-juggles-windows-7-and-android-50001114/ Mid 2011, the "Acer Aspire One Happy 2" line is released http://www.marketwire.com/press-release/acer-introduces-new-line-of-color-inspired-netbooks-for-us-consumers-1533384.htm. ==Reception== CNET editors' review has been positive,[http://laptops.bytesizetechreviews.com/acer-aspire-one-reviews Acer Aspire One Reviews]{{dead link|date=July 2011}}[http://reviews.cnet.com/laptops/acer-aspire-one-linpus/4505-3121_7-33190895.html?tag=mncol;txt CNET reviewers: "the best all-around Netbook we've seen for less than "] although held reservations as the Aspire One is early to market and many netbooks are planned for the near future. A [[The Tech Report]] (Techreport.com) review of the 751h, and the similar [[Gateway LT3103U]], was generally positive, praising the notebooks' battery life but criticizing the large number of third party software products preinstalled and running by default on the computers.http://techreport.com/articles.x/17249 ==See also== * [[Netbook]] * [[Comparison of netbooks]] * [[Comparison of subnotebooks]] ==References== {{Reflist|colwidth=30em}} ==External links== * {{Official website|www.acer.com/aspireone}} {{Netbooks}} {{Linux devices}} [[Category:2008 introductions]] [[Category:Linux-based devices]] [[Category:Netbooks]] [[Category:Android devices]] [[Category:Acer products]] [[ar:Ø£Ø³Ø± Ø£Ø³Ø¨Ø§ÙØ± ÙÙ]] [[ca:Acer Aspire One]] [[cs:Acer Aspire One]] [[da:Acer Aspire One]] [[de:Acer Aspire One]] [[es:Aspire One]] [[fr:Aspire One]] [[hi:à¤à¤¸à¤° à¤à¤¸à¥à¤ªà¤¾à¤¯à¤° à¤µà¤¨]] [[it:Acer Aspire One]] [[nl:Aspire One]] [[pt:Acer Aspire One]] [[ru:Acer Aspire One]] [[fi:Acer Aspire One]] [[uk:Acer Aspire one]] [[zh:Aspire One]]
